{{Refimprove|date=June 2010}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2015}} {{Use New Zealand English|date=May 2015}} {{Infobox school | name = Long Bay College | seal_image = | principal = Russell Brooke | motto = "Success with confidence and creativity." | fundingtype = State | gender = Co-educational | years = 9–13{{cite web|title=Ministry of Education - Long Bay College|url=http://www.minedu.govt.nz/Parents/AllAges/schoolSearch/SchoolDetails.aspx?s=27&type=40&hasGeo=true&sn=Long%20Bay%20College|accessdate=15 November 2013}} | established = 1975The school's 25th jubilee took place in 2000. {{cite journal|journal=Education Gazette New Zealand|title=Jubilees & reunions - Long Bay College|volume = 78|issue=5|date=29 March 1999}} | address = Ashley Avenue
[[Long Bay, New Zealand|Long Bay]]
[[Auckland]] 0630
New Zealand | coordinates = {{coord|-36.690653|174.741025|region:NZ_type:edu|display=inline,title}} | roll = {{NZ school roll data|27|y||y}} ({{NZ school roll data|||y}}) | decile = 10Z{{cite web |url= http://www.minedu.govt.nz/~/media/MinEdu/Files/EducationSectors/PrimarySecondary/SchoolOpsResourcing/OperationalFundingDeciles/DecileChanges_20142015.xls |title= Decile Change 2014 to 2015 for State & State Integrated Schools |publisher= Ministry of Education |accessdate= 12 February 2015}} | MOE = 27 | homepage = {{URL|http://www.longbaycollege.com}} }} '''Long Bay College''' is a [[state school|state]] co-educational secondary school located on the [[North Shore City|North Shore]] of [[Auckland]], [[New Zealand]]. The decile 10 school serves Years 9 to 13 (ages 12 to 18), and has {{NZ school roll data|27|y}} students as of {{NZ school roll data|||y|y||.}} Russell Brooke is the current principal of Long Bay College. ==History== Long Bay College opened in 1975. The very first Principal of Long Bay College was Ian Sage.{{cn|date=October 2015}} A road coming from the College was then named after him - Ian Sage Ave. Like most New Zealand state secondary schools of the 1970s, the school was built to the S68 design, characteriSed by single-storey classroom blocks with masonry walls, low-pitched roofs with protruding clerestory windows, and internal open courtyards.{{cite web |url= http://www.minedu.govt.nz/NZEducation/EducationPolicies/Schools/PropertyToolBox/StateSchools/Design/EarthquakeResilience/~/media/MinEdu/Files/EducationSectors/PrimarySecondary/PropertyToolbox/StateSchools/Design/General/MOEstandardbuildingcatalogue_ReV1.2.pdf |title= Catalogue of Standard School Building Types |publisher= Ministry of Education |location= Christchurch |date= August 2013 |accessdate= 10 July 2014}} ==Enrolment== At the May 2013 Education Review Office (ERO) review of the school, Long Bay College had 1657 students, including 99 [[international student]]s. The school roll's gender composition was 51% male and 49% female, and its ethnic composition was 52% [[New Zealand European]] (Pākehā), 17% [[South African people|South African]], 14% [[British people|British]]/[[Irish people|Irish]], 7% [[Asian people|Asian]], 4% [[Māori people|Māori]], 1% [[Pacific Islanders]], and 5% Other.{{cite web |url= http://www.ero.govt.nz/Early-Childhood-School-Reports/School-Reports/Long-Bay-College-14-06-2013 |title= Long Bay College Education Review |date= 14 June 2013 |publisher= Education Review Office |accessdate= 7 December 2013}} ==Notable alumni== *[[Bridgette Armstrong]] - played for the [[New Zealand women's national football team]], attended Long Bay College.{{Cite web|title=Bridgette Armstrong |publisher=New Zealand Football |url=http://www.nzsoccer.com/page/yff_armstrong_bridgette.html |accessdate=2010-06-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090915033203/http://www.nzsoccer.com/page/yff_armstrong_bridgette.html |archivedate=15 September 2009 }}{{Cite web | last =Ruane | first =Jeremy | title =“Army” Keen To Maintain The Family Tradition | work =Soccer | publisher =SportsWeb | url =http://www.sportswebsoccer.com/cgi-bin/control.pl?Function=News&Option=Feature3&Item=20080908.txt | accessdate =2010-06-09 }}{{Cite web | last =Maddaford | first =Terry | title =Soccer: Another Armstrong aims high | publisher =The New Zealand Herald | date =11 August 2007 | url =http://www.nzherald.co.nz/sport/news/article.cfm?c_id=4&objectid=10457038 | accessdate =2010-06-09 }} *[[List of Titanium members|Andrew Papas]] - member of the boyband [[Titanium (band)|Titanium]]. *[[Paul Wiseman]] - spin bowler and played international cricket for New Zealand ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.longbaycollege.com School website] *[http://www.ero.govt.nz/Early-Childhood-School-Reports/School-Reports?profileid=27 Education Review Office (ERO) reports] {{Schools in Auckland}} [[Category:Educational institutions established in 1975]] [[Category:Secondary schools in Auckland]] [[Category:North Shore, New Zealand]] [[Category:New Zealand secondary schools of S68 plan construction]] [[Category:1975 establishments in New Zealand]] {{NewZealand-school-stub}}
